derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: perhaps related to tag

entry.tran: (标明相关信息的)小布条，小标签，小纸条
entry.def: A tab is a small piece of cloth or paper that is attached to something, usually with information about that thing written on it.

example.ex: A stupid medical clerk had slipped the wrong tab on his X-ray.
example.tran: 一个蠢笨的医护人员一不留神在他的X光片上贴错了标签。

example.ex: ...a small red tab sewn on to the left-hand side of the back right pocket.
example.tran: 缝在右后口袋左边的一个小红布签

entry.def: A tab is the total cost of goods or services that you have to pay, or the bill or check for those goods or services.

example.ex: At least one estimate puts the total tab at $7 million...
example.tran: 至少有一个估价把总数定在了 700 万美元。

example.ex: 'I'll get my purse out of the bedroom.' — 'No sweat, Mrs. Day. We can put it on your tab.'
example.tran: “我去卧室拿钱包。”——“别费事了，戴夫人，我们就记在你的账单上好了。”

entry.def: A tab is a metal strip that you pull off the top of a can of drink in order to open it.
A tab is a drug, especially one that is sold illegally, which is in tablet form.

example.ex: One tab of Ecstasy costs at least £15.
example.tran: 一粒摇头丸至少卖 15 英镑。

entry.tran: 密切注意，严密监视(某人的一举一动)
entry.def: If someone keeps tabs on you, they make sure that they always know where you are and what you are doing, often in order to control you.

example.ex: It was obvious Hill had come over to keep tabs on Johnson and make sure he didn't do anything drastic.
example.tran: 显然，希尔是来密切监视约翰逊的，以确保他不做出什么过激举动。

entry.def: If you pick up the tab, you pay a bill on behalf of a group of people or provide the money that is needed for something.

example.ex: Pollard picked up the tab for dinner that night...
example.tran: 那天的晚饭是波拉德掏的钱。

example.ex: Today any employee with back or shoulder pain can go straight to Mr Jay and the company will pick up the tab.
example.tran: 现如今，不论哪位雇员的背部或肩膀疼，都可以直接去找杰伊先生，费用由公司承担。

sentences.sentence: "he asked the waiter for the check"

means.word_mean: 5. a dose of medicine in the form of a small pellet

means.word_mean: 拉襻;扣环;(指引卡上的)突出部

sentences.en: Hang your coat up by the tab on the collar.
sentences.cn: 用衣服上的领襻把上衣挂起来。

sentences.en: He wore a cap with tabs over the ears.
sentences.cn: 他带一顶有护耳的帽子。

sentences.en: You can open the can by pulling the tab.
sentences.cn: 你可拉拉环把罐头打开。

sentences.en: I took my friend to lunch and paid the tab.
sentences.cn: 我出钱请我的一个朋友吃了午饭。

sentences.en: Her father picked up the tab for all the champagne at the wedding.
sentences.cn: 婚礼上所有的香槟酒都是他父亲买单。
